data.title: About: Elisha in Islam
data.meta_description: Alyasa (Arabic: اليسع, romanized: Alyasaʿ) is prophet and messenger of God who was sent to guide the Children of Israel. In the Quran, Alyasa is mentioned twice as a prophet, and is mentioned both times alongside fellow prophets. He is honored by Muslims as the prophetic successor to Ilyas (Elijah). Islamic sources that identify Elisha with Khidr cite the strong relationship between Khidr and Ilyas in Islamic tradition.
data.text:
dbo:abstract

Alyasa (Arabic: اليسع, romanized: Alyasaʿ) is prophet and messenger of God who was sent to guide the Children of Israel. In the Quran, Alyasa is mentioned twice as a prophet, and is mentioned both times alongside fellow prophets. He is honored by Muslims as the prophetic successor to Ilyas (Elijah). Islamic sources that identify Elisha with Khidr cite the strong relationship between Khidr and Ilyas in Islamic tradition. (en)
